event.name: AEA_SHLEG_CLEAR_CHOICE_SLUG
event.text: An Anarchist and a Kleptocracy ship have entered a dogfight at this beacon. It seems the only way to get past is to fight one of them.

You attack the Anarchist ship head on, prompting the Slug ship to break away. Apparently, their dedication to the hunt does not go so far as to putting themselves in debt of a Federation ship, and so they jump away to leave you alone with the Anarchists.
You attack the Slugs head on. The Anarchists don't seem to want to stick around to see the outcome, and jump away.

event.name: AEA_SHLEG_CLEAR_CHOICE_SHELL
event.text: An Anarchist and a Geniocracy ship have entered a dogfight at this beacon. It seems the only way to get past is to fight one of them.
You attack the Anarchist ship head on, prompting the Shell ship to break away. Shells are well known to be cowards, so it's no surprise when they jump away to leave you alone with the Anarchists.
You attack the Shells head on. The Anarchists don't seem to want to stick around to see the outcome, and jump away.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_SHLEG_ARGUMENT
event.text: You've arrived at the beacon to discover an Anarchist Slug Captain and an Anarchist Shell Captain in a heated argument over who is more evil, The Kleptocracy or the Geniocracy. The Slug Captain turns to you and asks which side you think is more evil.

choice.text: "You're right, the Kleptocracy is more evil."

event.text: "Sssseeeee, even the Federation think the Kleptocracy are more evil." The slug turns back to you. "Assss a token of my good will please take thissss weapon."

choice.text: "The Shell is right, the Geniocracy is more evil."

event.text: "You see, even thhhhhhe Federation thhhhhhink the Geniocracy are more evil." The shell turns back to you. "As a token of my good will please take thhhhis weapon."
"Thhhat is an interesting idea captain." Replies the shell captain. The slug turns back to you. "That isss a very honest answer, as a token of our good will please accept these supplies"

choice.text: Leave before you accidently insult them.

event.text: You don't have time for this.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_SHLEG_FUEL
event.text: At this beacon is an Anarchist trading station. You're hailed by a Shell onboard the station. "Hello Captain, It appears we've overstocked on fuel, would you be willing to buy it off us at a reduced price?"
The shell transfers over the fuel.
You don't need the extra fuel.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_SHLEG_KNIGHT
event.text: You've arrived at the beacon to discover a Slug Knight hiding in the nebula, you're lucky that you arrived just in time to pick them up through the nebula around you.

"Hello Captain, It sssuprissses me to see a federation captain all the way out here. Kniving with Anarchists are we? Well worry not, All we neeeed is sssome information. We're looking for an Anarchist trading station somewhere out here, if you'd just give us the cooridinates to the last Anarchists you've seeen we'll be on our way."

choice.text: (Trading Station Cooridinates) Give them the actual cooridinates to the trading station.

event.text: "A wise choice Captain, we will tell them of your betrayal." The ship jumps away however you notice they were in the process of scrapping a small Anarchist vessel. You loot the leftovers.
"A wise choice Captain, we will tell them of your betrayal." The ship jumps away however you notice they were in the process of scrapping a small Anarchist vessel. You loot the leftovers.
That'ssss an unfortunate choice Captain, We'll have to take those coordinates from your corpssee.
The ship turns to face you, it appears they knew you were there the entire time.

choice.text: Hide yourself before they pick you up.

event.text: You manage to obscure yourself in the nebula and charge up your FTL drive.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_SHLEG_DIGGING
event.text: You've arrived at the beacon to discover a planet under excavation. You're not sure what they're doing but they've dug a massive pit on the planet's surface. As you get closer you notice that they're actually excavation a massive crashed space ship, its mostly black with a feint green tinge in areas. There's a guard protecting the area.

choice.text: Attack the guard to access the ruins.

event.text: The guard sees you coming and activates it's weapons.
You manage to obscure yourself in the nebula and charge up your FTL drive.

event.name: DESTROYED_AEA_SHLEG_RUIN
event.text:
Despite all their defensive measures, the Guard ship has been defeated. You scrap the remains.
With the ship now out of the way you're free to inspect the ruins.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_SHLEG_SPACE_WHALE
event.text: There's a pod of space whales at this beacon, you notice a slug clasman hiding in the nebula waiting for one of the whales to seperate from the pack.
You prepare for combat.
You manage to obscure yourself in the nebula and charge up your FTL drive.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_SHLEG_NEUROTOXINLAB
event.text: Through the clouds of this nebula you spot a Rebel science station. It's strange to see one of these in Anarchist space, but surely there's a good reason.
Strangely, no Rebel ships interrupt you as you approach. Even stranger, the station appears to be empty of all life-signs except for one.

Surely, only one Rebel could cause no harm to you. You send over your crew. Inside, they find a large laboratory scattered with the corpses of scientists, though none have any visible wounds. The room smells faintly strange.

Your crew continue through the station, searching for the life-sign you had detected earlier. They find an unshaven, dishevelled engineer rocking back and forth, drooling and hugging a large cube. Your crew manage to calm him down long enough for him to explain the situation. It appears the engineers aboard were tasked with researching the neurotoxin released by the Shells and weaponize it, when one of their Auto-ships turned hostile. Using the toxin, it killed off all of the other scientists. The engineer warns you that now that you've boarded the station, the AI must know you're here too!
Your crew, followed by the psychotic engineer, hurry back to the ship. As they do, a large Auto-ship detaches from the station and chases you!

choice.text: This is strange. Pull out your crew.

event.text: You call the crew back to the ship, just in case.
You put some distance between yourself and the Rebel station, for good measure.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_SHLEG_HIDDEN_COLONY
event.text: You catch the rear of an Anarchist ship slip away into the nebula. If you're quick, you might be able to catch up to them.
As you follow the ship through the nebula, you're shocked to find a massive Shell colony between several connected stations.
You hail the Shells within the colony. They wait for what you will say.
You decide the best course of action here is to attack these peaceful aliens for no good reason.
There is some talk amongst the Shells, but it seems they all agree trading with you will bring no harm.

choice.text: Demand they hand over some supplies.

event.text: You don't know what's happening here, but whatever that lone Shell ship is doing is of no concern to your mission.

destroyed.text: The Station explodes, rupturing the connections between the other stations nearby.

event.text: The Anarchists want to avoid a fight at all costs. They hand over what supplies they can spare.
The colony does not take well to your demands. They retaliate with their weapons!

event.name: AEA_SHLEG_HIDDEN_COLONY_SURRENDER
event.text: "Please, stop! We will give you anythhhing, please just spare thhhe rest of us!"

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_AEA_SHLEG_CHOICE
event.text: You spot an Anarchist ship approaching a small Slug transport. You aren't sure what the Slugs did to deserve this, but they appear to be in trouble.

Almost immediately after moving to help the Slugs they jump away, sending one last message to your ship's computer. "Psych!" The Anarchist ship is confused but assumes you have something to do with it and attacks!
You ignore the Slug ship and move past.

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_AEA_SHLEG_GAS
event.text: The distress beacon is originating from a nearby shell vessel, they reach out as soon as you arrive. "Please rescue us, our ship has been flooded with Anarchist mind control gas. If you dock with us your ship will also be flooded but your oxygen system should get rid of it in 90 seconds."

choice.text: Dock and purge the gas to save the shells!

event.name: AEA_SHLEG_GAS_TIMER_START_LONG
event.text: You dock the ship and begin draining the mind control gas onto your own ship. It will now take 90 seconds for the gas to drain.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: The gas will clear when this timer runs out, survive until then.

choice.text: (Upg. Oxygen) Dock and purge the gas 1.5x as fast.

event.name: AEA_SHLEG_GAS_TIMER_START_SHORT
event.text: You dock the ship and begin draining the mind control gas onto your own ship. It will now take 60 seconds for the gas to drain.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: The gas will clear when this timer runs out, survive until then.

event.text: Unfortunately, docking with their ship is likely too hazardous, considering Shell ships contain neurotoxin gasses. It's best for you to not get involved.

event.name: AEA_SHLEG_GAS_TIMER
event.text: You survived the gas and purged it from both your own ship and the Shell's ship. They thank you and send over a large reward

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_AEA_SHLEG
event.text: Anarchist civilians aren't usually ones for direct combat... but with their conflicts with both the Geniocracy and Kleptocracy, a few have felt the need to take it into their own hands to protect the sector. Apparently, you're a threat, because the nearby Anarchist ship attacks!

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_AEA_SHLEG_STORM
event.text: It appears an Anarchist ship is waiting inside this Ion storm. For what reasons they find you hostile you aren't sure, but it appears you can't get out of this fight so easily.

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_AEA_SHLEG_SLUG
event.text: Usually, a standard Slug ship wouldn't have made it this far into Anarchist sectors. However, one outlier ship appears to have crossed paths with you, and now it seems they're looking to fight!

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_AEA_SHLEG_AUTO
event.text: The Rebels aren't big fans of the Anarchists, but they're usually too afraid of their toxins to attack them in person. Instead, they prefer to send Auto-ships to do their dirty work. Unfortunately, one of these Auto-ships recognizes you and attacks!

event.name: NEBULA_SHELL_SMUGGLER
event.text: It appears a Smuggler ship is trying to sneak their way through this nebula! They notice you watching them and attack, not wanting you to rat out their location!

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_SHLEG_UNIQUE_BATTLE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A large scale battle is taking place here, The Anarchists have an active distress beacon on.

event.text: A massive battle is taking place at this beacon, you can immediately tell that the Anarchists are losing. A large Anarchist ship at the center of the battle is being attacked by an equally large slug KoN vessel, it appears they're on the defensive and don't have long to live.

choice.text: Move in front to defend the Anarchist ship.

event.text: The Anarchist ship is now unable to defend itself, and so when you move in to protect them, they're unable to help you.

The large Anarchist ship eventually splits apart under fire from the slugs, at this the battle quickly turns with the remaining Anarchists either being destroyed or fleeing. You hide in the nebula and charge your FTL drive.

event.name: AEA_SHLEG_KNIGHT_BATTLE_WIN
event.text: You've destroyed the knight vessel and secured the safety of the large Anarchist ship. With that win the battle has turned and the anarchist ships begin pushing back the slugs.

With the slugs on the retreat the Anarchist ship you rescued hails you. A Slug and Shell both appear on screen, these two aren't in normal anarchist colours. "Hello Captain, We're thankful for your help back there. We were wondering whether you'd help with a job we have planned. We'll spare most of the details but just know you'll have to distract the enemy for a time."

"Alright, we've discovered a heavily defended Radiant research base nearby, we'll need you to distract them while we sneak onboard the station. You'll need to be careful though, We can't risk you killing the guard and putting the base on lockdown. Insead you'll need to just keep them in combat for a few minutes while we work on the research base. we'll send over the coordinates."

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_AEA_SHLEG_RADIANT_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Coordinates given by the two strange Anarchists.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: Through a clearing in the nebula you find the research base the Anarchists promised, alongside a dangerous looking guard. You move back into the nebula to wait for the Anarchists to arrive.

A few moments later a small dark vessel arrives, initially you think it must belong to the slug knights but when it hails you, you realize its the Anarchists. Those two same Anarchists show up on the comms again. "We're here Captain, Remember do not kill the guard, just distract them until we're finished. We'll move in once you start."
You fly out of the nebula with weapons armed. The guard responds in kind
When the anarchists realize you're not going to attack they jump away, clearly frustrated with you.

event.name: DEFEAT_AEA_SHLEG_RADIANT_ELITE
event.text: A Radiant vessel has fallen to your ship. You'd better have held off killing this ship or else you may have just gotten those Anarchists killed.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Shell ship survived the fight. Inside is an Anti-Hull weapon, which you bring back on board.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Keep the guard alive until this timer ends.

event.name: AEA_SHLEG_RADIANT_QUEST_WIN
event.text: "We're out. We'll come dock with your ssssship."

The two anarchists dock with your ship and come onboard, one of them is holding a large tank full of gas that appears to be shifting colours. "Excellent work Captain, you handled that quite professionally and allowed us to get our hands on thhhhhis prototype gas."
The slug picks up the conversation, "Sssssorry we haven't introduced oursselvesss properly, I'm sssickle and this is ssorrow, we were the original founding membersss of the Anarchistsss." Sorrow then continues, "We have one last proposition for you. We'd bothhh like to continue along withhh you on your ship, however one of us needs to take thhhhis gas back to our researchers." "We need you to pick between usssss."
Alongside their offer they also give you the blueprints to a new ship and a nice amount of scrap.

choice.text: (Anarchist Crew + Good Reputation) Offer to send your own crewmember back instead.

event.text: "What an excellent idea captain, I do hope your crew doesn't mind."
Sorrow steps onboard behind Sickle.
"It'ss my pleasure to ssserve along ssside you Captain." Sickle turns to Sorrow and says her good byes.
"Thhhis will be a nice change of pace." Sorrow turns to Sickle and says her good byes.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_SHLEG_OUTPOST_QUEST
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover a federation station however when you hail them you get a strange response, a camera feed appears showing the inside of the outpost appears to be filled with some strange gas, you can't see anyone around.

As you move in to dock you're interupted when an Anarchist ship emerges from the clouds. "Hey this is our experi- Oh damn that's a renegade, looks like they're with the Federation, we need to get out here!" The Anarchist ship takes off into the clouds.

You're able to track them through the clouds rather easily, it appears they forgot to turn off their comms. After a while you hear one tell another to put in a set of coordinates into the coordinates before the ship jumps away. You mark the coordinates on your own map.
You turn back to the outpost but when you dock you find all of the crew dead. You scrap what you can.

choice.text: Leave before anything bad happens to you aswell.

event.text: You back off into the nebula and charge your FTL drive.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_SHLEG_OUTPOST_QUEST2

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Coordinates picked up from the Anarchist ship that escaped.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You arrive at the beacon and pick up the Anarchists. It appears they're communicating with a tiny research outpost.
"Oh no, they followed us, I told you we left the comms on!"
You back off into the nebula and charge your FTL drive.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_SHLEG_OUTPOST_QUEST_WIN
event.text: You've destroyed the usual ship and you loot it for everything they have. You find a weapon amongst the wreckage.
You then turn you attention to the research base, onboard you find a complete sector map, aswell as the blueprint to the ship you destroyed.
